publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-797 Donald Gorrie: Ending of Monthly Poll of Scots' Voting Intentions by The Herald-That the Parliament regrets the decision by The Herald to stop its monthly polling of voting intentions in Scotland; considers that the poll makes a useful contribution to bringing public and political issues before the people of Scotland, and urges the management of The Herald to reconsider the decision.
S2M-797 Ending of Monthly Poll of Scots' Voting Intentions by The Herald (lodged on 19 January 2004) Alex Neil*

S2M-797 Donald Gorrie: Ending of Monthly Poll of Scots' Voting Intentions by The Herald-That the Parliament regrets the decision by The Herald to stop its monthly polling of voting intentions in Scotland; considers that the poll makes a useful contribution to bringing public and political issues before the people of Scotland, and urges the management of The Herald to reconsider the decision. Supported by: Alex Neil, Susan Deacon*
S2M-797 Ending of Monthly Poll of Scots' Voting Intentions by The Herald (lodged on 19 January 2004) Rob Gibson*, Tommy Sheridan*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-797 Ending of Monthly Poll of Scots' Voting Intentions by The Herald (lodged on 19 January 2004) Iain Smith*, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-797 Ending of Monthly Poll of Scots' Voting Intentions by The Herald (lodged on 19 January 2004) Alasdair Morgan*
S2M-797 Ending of Monthly Poll of Scots' Voting Intentions by The Herald (lodged on 19 January 2004) Mr Adam Ingram*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-797 Ending of Monthly Poll of Scotsâ€™ Voting Intentions by The Herald (lodged on 19 January 2004) Linda Fabiani*
